metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1637 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw that boot CPU could be vulnerable for the speculative execution behavior kind of attacks in the Linux kernel X86 CPU Power management options functionality was found in the way user resuming CPU from suspend-to-RAM. A local user could use this flaw to potentially get unauthorized access to some memory of the CPU similar to the speculative execution behavior kind of attacks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132
linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-117.132
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-lowlatency - 5.4.0-117.132
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1078-aws - 5.4.0-1078.84
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1014-aws - 5.15.0-1014.18~20.04.1
No subscription required
